titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Moses Baer, Indictment
CWG6643

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Ohio Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Moses Baer

The Grand Jury of Ohio County in the name and by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Moses Baer of the offence of Keeping a tippling house. Committed as follows namely viz. The said Moses Baer on the day of May 1862 And on divers days since in the County aforesaid. Kept a tippling house against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
Information given by John Ford, Peter Thomas, John Thomas, Virgil Addington, David Mosely, Thomas Mosely, James Colllins, William Eidson, Henry Small and William Rosenburg

A. Copy
Attest A. L. Morton clk
Ohio Circuit Court

Comth of Ky
vs } Tippling House
Moses Baer
A. True bill
Jos Leach foreman of the Grand Jury
Filed March 28th 1863
A. L. Morton clk
A Copy Attest
A. L. Morton clk
